intro: Derris seorsa, commonly known as the wild senna, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds used in traditional medicine. Derris seorsa is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
